info.lead: Record and manage all wedding expenses. You can enter quotes, confirm them as approved expenses, and track payment statuses. Filter by category, spend type (common/bride/groom), and status.
info.title: Complete Expense Management
info.description: On this page you can record all actual expenses and quotes. Each expense can be categorized, assigned to bride/groom/common, and tracked with approval and payment status. Expenses confirmed from the dashboard automatically appear here.

tips.tip1: Use the 'Quote' status for received offers, then change to 'Approved' when you confirm
tips.tip2: The 'From quote' field indicates if the expense comes from the dashboard (already budgeted)
tips.tip3: Always add the supplier to keep track of who provided each service
tips.tip4: Filter by category or spend type to analyze where you're spending more

eventTypeSpecific.wedding: For a wedding, you can split expenses between bride, groom, and common. This helps understand each contribution and manage finances transparently.
eventTypeSpecific.baptism: For a baptism, all expenses are automatically set as 'common' ‚Äî no need to specify who pays.
eventTypeSpecific.birthday: For a birthday, split expenses between the main organizer and any shared costs.
eventTypeSpecific.graduation: For a graduation, track all event-related expenses: venue, catering, invitations, decorations, and keepsakes.

messages.mustAuthAdd: You must be authenticated to add expenses. Click 'Register' at the top.

info.lead: Track all incomes that contribute to the wedding budget: parents' gifts, family contributions, personal savings, or other sources. Specify whether the income is from the bride, the groom, or common.
info.title: Track All Incomes
info.description: Here you can record all sources of money contributing to your event budget: family contributions, cash gifts, bank transfers, personal savings. Each income can be categorized to know who brings it (bride/groom/common) and from whom it comes.

tips.tip1: Use 'Envelope' for cash gifts received during the event
tips.tip2: Use 'Bank transfer' for contributions received before the event
tips.tip3: Use 'Physical gift' to record material gifts (without a specific amount)
tips.tip4: The total of incomes helps you understand how much effective budget you have available

eventTypeSpecific.wedding: During weddings, it's customary to receive envelopes with monetary contributions from guests. Record every envelope received for a complete tracking.
eventTypeSpecific.baptism: For a baptism, record contributions from godparents and family members who want to participate in the expenses.
eventTypeSpecific.birthday: For a birthday, track contributions from friends and relatives who want to help with the organization.
eventTypeSpecific.graduation: For a graduation, record family contributions and gifts received to celebrate the milestone.
